data.actor2: OLF: Oromo Liberation Front (Shane Splinter Faction)
data.notes: On 4 August 2023, and for the second day, ENDF clashed with OLF Shane in Kiremu town, Kiremu woreda (East Wellega, Oromia). Casualties unknown.

data.actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Federal Police
data.assoc_actor_2: NaMA: National Movement of Amhara; Government of Ethiopia (2018-)
data.notes: On 4 August 2023, Federal Police arrested an opposition leader of NaMA and a member of the Ethiopian Parliament and chair of Standing Committee for Public Expenditures and Administration Control from his home in Addis Ababa, Lideta (Region 14, Addis Ababa). Some sources claim the police beat him during his capture. The reason is unknown, could be most likely related to the newly declared SOE.

data.source: Al Ayn; AP; BBC News; Borkena Ethiopian News; Deutsche Welle; EMS; ESAT; GardaWorld; TIKVAH Ethiopia; VOA; Wazema Radio
data.notes: Security measures: On 4 August 2023, Ethiopian Council of Ministers declared a State of Emergency (SoE) in the Amhara State to following days of armed clashes between the ENDF and Fano militia in several parts of the region (coded separately). The statement says, 'attacks of extremist armed groups' had reached a stage where it was no longer possible to control with regular law enforcement mechanisms', adding that the situation had 'endangered the constitutional order' and 'disrupted the people's overall economic and social activities'. Event coded to Addis Ababa, Lideta (Region 14, Addis Ababa).
On 4 August 2023, an unidentified armed group fired mortar and heavy weapons in and around Debre Markos town (East Gojam, Amhara). No further information. Casualties unknown.

data.assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Federal Police
data.notes: On 3 August 2023, Fano militias and ENDF continued to clash in Maraki, Kebele 18, and Tederos and Fasil campus of Gondar University areas in Gonder town (Central Gondar, Amhara). The armed clash began on the evening of 2 August (coded separately). At least 20 people were killed, including an assistant professor who was giving the 12th-grade national exam at Gondar University and two federal police who were guarding the university, and an unidentified number of people, including students in Gondar University and a federal police officer, were injured. The number of fatalities split into two events. Over 16,000 students were unable to take the exam.
On 3 August 2023, ENDF clashed with Fano militias in Asketema, Gazgibla woreda (location not found and coded to admin center, Sekota, Sekota town, in Wag Hamra zone, Amhara). Casualties unknown.

data.actor2: OLF: Oromo Liberation Front (Shane Splinter Faction)
data.notes: On 3 August 2023, in a clash that lasted for two days, ENDF clashed with OLF Shane in Kiremu town, Kiremu woreda (East Wellega, Oromia). Casualties unknown.

On 3 August 2023, rioters who opposed ENDF and the government's action in Amhara region and support Fano militias, looted the Police training center and public offices in Debre Markos town (East Gojam, Amhara) after Fano militias entered the town. Witnesses clearly stated that Fano militias were not involved in the looting. A day before this event, roads were closed (coded separately) and on 4 August 2023, heavy weapons were fired by an unidentified armed group in and around the town (coded separately).

data.assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Federal Police
data.notes: On 2 August 2023, Fano militias and ENDF clashed in Maraki, kebele 18, and Tederos and Fasil campus of Gondar University areas in Gonder town (Central Gondar, Amhara). The armed clash continued the next day (coded separately). At least 20 people were killed, including an assistant professor who was giving the 12th-grade national exam at Gondar University and two federal police who were guarding the university, and an unidentified number of people, including students in Gondar University and a federal police officer, were injured. The number of fatalities split into two events. Over 16,000 students were unable to take the exam.
On 2 August 2023, ENDF clashed with Fano militias around Kobo town, Kobo (North Wello, Amhara), forcing the closure of private and public businesses in the town. Casualties unknown.
Around 2 August 2023 (week of), ENDF clashed with Fano militias in Amara Sayint town, Sayint woreda (South Wello, Amhara). Casualties unknown.
Around 2 August 2023 (week of), ENDF clashed with Fano militias in Wegde woreda (in an unspecified location coded to Hurufa, Wegdi, South Wello, Amhara). Casualties unknown.

Around 2 August 2023 (week of), ENDF clashed with Fano militias in 'several' unspecified areas of West Gojam zone, (location coded to admin center, Bahir Dar town, Bahir Dar, West Gojam, Amhara). Casualties unknown.
On 2 August 2023, ENDF clashed with Fano militias in Asketema, Gazgibla woreda (location not found and coded to admin center, Sekota, Sekota town, in Wag Hamra zone, Amhara). Casualties unknown.

On 2 August 2023, and for the second day, ENDF clashed with Fano militias around Lalibela, Lasta woreda (North Wello, Amhara). Some diplomatic sources claimed 'Fano militias taken control of the airport', but the information not confirmed. Casualties unknown.
On 2 August 2023, ENDF and Fano militias clashed in Addis Zemen (Libokemekem, South Gondar, Amhara) and Yifag (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
On 2 August 2023, ENDF and Fano militias clashed in Yefag ( South Gondar, Amhara) and Addis Zemen (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

data.source: Al Jazeera; EMS; Reuters; Wazema Radio
data.notes: On 2 August 2023, ENDF and Fano militias continued to clash in or around Debre Tabor town (South Gondar, Amhara). An unidentified number of casualties of Fanos and ENDF were reported and hospital sources claimed to have admitted around dozens combatants wounded. At least, three civilians, including two drivers of a Bajaj and a truck, were killed. The armed clash began on 1 August 2023 (coded separately). All roads were closed by stones. According to a witness, the armed clash began when ENDF tried to mobilize its soldiers from Gondar to Woldiya. The number of civilian fatalities split in to two events and 3 fatalities coded for combatants; fatalities coded as 4.

data.actor2: OLF: Oromo Liberation Front (Shane Splinter Faction)
data.notes: On 2 August 2023, ENDF clashed with OLF Shane in Tija Jangir town (a location coded to Ayana, in Gida Ayana woreda, East Wellega, Oromia), resulting in an unknown number of combatants getting killed and wounded from both sides. An unidentified number of fatalities mentioned coded as 3.

data.actor1: OLF: Oromo Liberation Front (Shane Splinter Faction)
data.actor2: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) SNNP State Police
data.notes: On 2 August 2023, OLF Shane exchanged fire with SNNP Regional State Police in Bue, Bui town, Sodo woreda (Gurage, SNNP), when the armed group opened fire to attack a police station and release their members detained. At least two police officers were wounded and the armed group left the areas after clashing for an hour. There were no fatalities.

On 2 August 2023, a group closed roads with stones and sticks in Debre Markos town (East Gojam, Amhara) and Bure (coded separately), in a demonstration against the government and ENDF, declaring their support to Fano militia. As a result, public offices and business centers were closed.

On 2 August 2023, a group of youth closed roads with stones and sticks in Bure town (West Gojam, Amhara) and Debre Markos (coded separately), in a demonstration against the government and ENDF, declaring their support to Fano militia.

On 1 August 2023, in a clash that lasted for two days, ENDF clashed with Fano militias around Lalibela, Lasta woreda (North Wello, Amhara). The clash forced local flights not to land the Lalibela Airport and return. Some sources claimed 'Fano militias taken control of the airport', but the information not confirmed. Casualties unknown.
On 1 August 2023, ENDF clashed with Fano militias around Kobo town, Kobo (North Wello, Amhara), forcing the closure of private and public businesses in the town. Casualties unknown.

data.source: Al Jazeera; EMS; Reuters; Wazema Radio
data.notes: On 1 August 2023, ENDF and Fano militias clashed in or around Debre Tabor town (South Gondar, Amhara). At least, three civilians, including two drivers of a Bajaj and a truck, were killed and hospital sources claimed to have admitted around dozens combatants wounded. The armed clash continued the next day (coded separately). According to a witness, the armed clash began when ENDF tried to mobilize its soldiers from Gondar to Woldiya. Fano and the youth closed the roads by placing stones. The number of fatalities split in to two events, coded as 2.

Security measures: On 1 August 2023, Sekota town security council declared night time curfew starting from 8 pm and other restrictions, including disseminating false narratives and information to incite conflict between ethnic groups and carrying weapons in public in Sekota town (Wag Hamra, Amhara) in order to celebrate Shaday celebration peacefully.

On 1 August 2023, a group closed roads with stones and sticks in Dembecha ( West Gojam, Amhara) and Amanuel (coded separately), in a demonstration against the government and ENDF, declaring their support to Fano militia.

On 1 August 2023, a group closed roads with stones and sticks in Amanuel (Michakel, West Gojam, Amhara) and Dembecha (coded separately), in a demonstration against the government and ENDF, declaring their support to Fano militia.

data.actor1: OLF: Oromo Liberation Front (Shane Splinter Faction)
data.notes: On 31 July 2023, OLF Shane allegedly kidnapped 63 civilians in Tulu Milki kebele (a location coded to admin center, Gebre Guracha, in Kuyu woreda, North Shewa, Oromia), after stopping a public transport bus travelling from Bahir Dar to Addis Ababa. The bus driver and his aid were also among those kidnapped.

On 31 July 2023, Fano militias and ENDF clashed in Anoba and Debot mountains around Sanka town (Guba Lafto, North Wello zone, Amhara), following attacks against the local administrators in town by an armed group assumed to be Fano militia on 29 July 2023 (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
On 31 July 2023, ENDF clashed with Fano militias in Kobo town, Kobo (North Wello, Amhara), forcing the closure of private and public businesses in the town. Casualties unknown.

On 31 July 2023, ENDF clashed with Fano militias in several villages (Sanka, Tikur wuha, Jarsa, Dedo and other unknown villages) around Woldiya town, Weldiya (North Wello, Amhara). Casualties unknown.

data.actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Amhara State Police
data.notes: On 31 July 2023, Amhara regional state police exchanged gun fire with kidnappers (coded as unidentified armed group) in Finjit kebele, Alfa woreda (Central Gondar, Amhara) during a rescue operation to release an Israeli citizen abducted on 9 July in Gondar (coded separately). The government forces announced they managed to rescue the hostage and capture one of the three kidnappers. There were no fatalities.
On 31 July 2023, an unidentified armed group clashed with ENDF in Dembecha (West Gojam, Amhara), Feres Bet, Finote Selam, Kwarit, Jiga, Mota, and Weyen Wha (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 31 July 2023, an unidentified armed group clashed with ENDF in Feres Bet (Dega Damot, West Gojam, Amhara), Dembecha, Finote Selam, Kwarit, Jiga, Mota, and Weyen Wha (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 31 July 2023, an unidentified armed group clashed with ENDF in Finote Selam town (West Gojam, Amhara), Feres Bet, Dembecha, Kwarit, Jiga, Mota, and Weyen Wha (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 31 July 2023, an unidentified armed group clashed with ENDF clashed in Kwarit (Debub Mecha, West Gojam, Amhara), Feres Bet, Finote Selam, Dembecha, Jiga, Mota, and Weyen Wha (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 31 July 2023, an unidentified armed group clashed with ENDF group clashed in Jiga (Jabi Tehnan, West Gojam, Amhara), Feres Bet, Finote Selam, Kwarit, Dembecha, Mota, and Weyen Wha (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 31 July 2023, an unidentified armed group clashed with ENDF clashed in Motta (Hulet Ej Enese, East Gojam, Amhara), Feres Bet, Finote Selam, Kwarit, Jiga, Dembecha, and Weyen Wha (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 31 July 2023, an unidentified armed group clashed with ENDF clashed in Weyen Wha (location not found, coded at Motta, Hulet Ej Enese, East Gojam, Amhara), Feres Bet, Finote Selam, Kwarit, Jiga, Dembecha, and Motta (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

data.assoc_actor_1: Orthodox Christian Group (Ethiopia); Oromo Ethnic Group (Ethiopia)
data.notes: On 31 July 2023, ethnic Oromo Orthodox Christians staged a protest in Jimma town, Jima (Jimma, Oromia) to demonstrate their opposition against the 'newly appointed religious leader' by the holy synod of Ethiopia and demanded the 'return of an Oromo speaking leader controversially appointment and removed following the disputes between the religious leaders.

On 30 July 2023, ENDF clashed with Fano militias in Shewa Robit town (in 01 kebele), Shoa Robit (North Shewa, Amhara), resulting in unknown number of people, including civilians getting killed. An unidentified number of fatalities mentioned coded as 3.

data.actor1: Military Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Republican Guard
data.notes: On 30 July 2023, Republican Guards (who were returning from Moscow) beat and attacked two Congolese journalists in Addis Ababa, Bole International Airport (Region 14, Addis Ababa). One of the attacked journalists, who works for Actualite CD, was beaten and his phone snatched while he was filming the Republican Guards when they were threatening another Congolese journalist known for his TV broadcasts and political positions against President Tshisekedi's power. The Actualite CD thanked the airport agents for helping its journalist recover his phone and belongings. The media also condemned the act saying it is an 'aggression and the threats made against its journalist'.

Looting: Around 30 July 2023 (as reported), an unidentified armed group (who wore military uniforms) stopped 'several vehicles' on the main highway connecting Addis Ababa to Jimma at around Gibe river, Sekoru woreda (Jimma, Oromia) and looted unknown amounts of cash from drivers. For those who refused to give money, the armed group also smashed the windows of their vehicles.

On 29 July 2023, ENDF clashed with Fano militias in Shewa Robit town (in a location named Firfir in the town), Shoa Robit (North Shewa, Amhara), resulting in at least 5 civilians getting killed in cross fire.

On 29 July 2023, an armed group, assumed to be Fano militia, shot and killed the Head of Guba Lafto Woreda Education Office and injured six people, including the head of Ras Ali Prosperity Party office in Sanka town in Guba Lafto woreda (North Wello zone, Amhara).

data.source: Addis Maleda; Addis Standard; Deutsche Welle; EMS; Reporter (Ethiopia); TIKVAH Ethiopia; VOA
data.notes: On 29 July 2023, unidentified gun men (coded as unidentified ethnic militia) attacked around 20 civilians who were heading to market, killing eight, including elderly and pregnant women, and injuring the rest in Dida kebele (location coded to admin center, Inseno, in Misrak Meskan woreda, Guraghe, SNNP). The incident happened amid increased tension between Mareko and Meskan ethnic groups due to disputes over territory, currently administered under East Meskan woreda. The frequency of violence targeting civilians in the area increased in July 2023.

On 28 July 2023, Fano militias clashed with ENDF forces in a location called 'Amhara Sient' in Borena-Debresina (coded to Mekane Selam, South Wello, Ahmara) . No further information. Casualties unknown.

data.assoc_actor_1: Former TPLF: Tigray People's Liberation Front
data.notes: On 28 July 2023, over 6000 war injured former TPLF fighters staged a protest in Mekele town, around Hayahulet area, Mekelle (Mekelle Tigray, Tigray), to demand the rehabilitation support from the government as per the Pretoria Peace agreement between TPLF and the Ethiopian government. The protesters said 'we lost our bodies in responding to the calls by the regional government and we deserve support.' The police forces dispersed the crowd by unknown means. This demonstration was held a day after the regional interim government announced that over 50,000 militants were discharged from the armed group known as the Tigray Defense Force (TDF). The demonstrators stated that they were discharged in October 2022, which will affect their participation per the Pretoria Peace agreement.

On 28 July 2023, ENDF soldiers beat, shot and killed 2 civilians in Shewa Robit, Shoa Robit (North Shewa, Amhara), after conducting home-to-home searches and accusing them of growing their hair (Fano-like hair style) and saving songs (promoting Fano) on their phones and posting Fano images in their homes. One of the victims was shot and killed while another one died to sustained injury due to beating.
On 27 July 2023, Fano militias clashed with ENDF forces in Fogera (South Gondar, Amhara). At least 4 people, including a local official, were killed in the fighting.

data.actor1: OLF: Oromo Liberation Front (Shane Splinter Faction)
data.notes: On 27 July 2023, OLF Shane kidnapped 2 civilians in Chafe kebele (location coded to admin center, Degem Hambiso, in Degem woreda, North Shewa, Oromia). The two abductees and four members of the armed group died after being taken by the overflowing river when the armed group was on the run with the people they kidnapped.

On 27 July 2023, ENDF soldiers beat and injured an unknown number of civilians in Shewa Robit, Shoa Robit (North Shewa, Amhara), after conducting home-to-home searches and accusing them of growing their hair (Fano-like hair style) and saving songs (promoting Fano) into their phones and posting Fano images at their homes. There were no fatalities.

data.source: Addis Maleda; Addis Standard; Borkena Ethiopian News; VOA; Wazema Radio
data.notes: On 26 July 2023, Fano militias blocked the road and opened fire at a convoy of senior ENDF members of North Western Command around Chuahit, West Dembiya (Central Gondar, Amhara), while they were heading to visit the Gorgora project. The clash resulted in an unknown number of people getting killed and wounded from both sides. The local government condemned the attack saying it was 'inappropriate agitation against the defense forces'. An unidentified number of fatalities mentioned coded as 10.

On 26 July 2023, ENDF clashed with Fano militias ambushed and clashed with ENDF on patrol at the Asfachew area, which is located at the main road connecting Shewa Robit and Debre Sina (North Shewa, Amhara), resulting in around 6 people getting killed. The armed clash in the area forced the closure of regular public offices.

data.actor2: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Oromia State Police
data.notes: Around 26 July 2023 (as reported), farmers staged a protest in Bura Jale and Waji Gush kebeles (both locations coded to the main town, Sagure in Degeluna Tijo woreda, Arsi, Oromia) to demand the provision of fertilizer. Government security forces (presumably, Oromia regional state police) beat and dispersed the protesters. No further information is available.

Around 26 July 2023 (week of), unidentified gun men, allegedly Qemant ethnic militias, shot and killed 6 people in Meshla kebele (a location coded to admin center, Metema town), in Metema woreda (West Gondar, Amhara).

On 25 July 2023, government forces (assumed to be ENDF) and Fano militias exchanged fire in Filakit Gergera town, Meket woreda (North Wello, Amhara) and resulted in an unknown number of people killed and wounded from both sides. An unidentified number of fatalities mentioned coded as 3.

On 24 July 2023, Anyuak ethnic militias and Nuwer ethnic militias clashed in Hulde kebele, (location coded to Itang, in Itang Special woreda, (Itang Special woreda, Gambela), resulting in 12 people being killed and an unknown number of others being wounded. Inter-communal tensions sparked following the clashes between the two ethnic groups in May 2023 in Itang Special woreda (coded separately). Some opposition claimed ethnic Anyuak members of the regional police forces participated in attacking ethnic Nuer civilians. Residents from both sides were displaced and several houses burned down.

On 24 July 2023, nighttime, ENDF clashed with Fano militias in Agiret, Meket woreda (North Wello, Amhara), resulting in 6 Fano militias getting killed. ENDF reinforcement deployed in the area following the clash.

data.actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Amhara State Police
data.notes: On 24 July 2023, local police and militia members (coded as Keble militias) on patrol clashed with local Fano members in Weldiya town (North Wello, Amhara). Three civilians, one women, and two local youths who were in the area were killed. The fighting went on for couple of hours and it ended before mid-night.

data.actor2: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) SNNP State Police
data.source: Deutsche Welle; Oromiya Media Network; VOA; Wazema Radio
data.notes: On 24 July 2023, Farmers of Hadiya zone staged a protest in Hosaena town, Hosaena (Hadiya, SNNP) to demand the provision of fertilizer. The protesters complained that the fertilizer quota diverted to local traders and they are unable to afford the high prices set by traders. SNNP police fired on the air and beat the farmers who were heading to the zonal administration carrying yoke to voice their complaints and resulted in an unknown number of protesters being injured in an stamped. Eleven people accused of participating in the protest were also arrested.

On 23 July 2023, unidentified gun men (coded as Unidentified Ethnic Militia) shot and killed 3 people (members of the same family and their neighbor) in Beche kebele (location coded to admin center, Inseno, in Misrak Meskan woreda, Guraghe, SNNP). The incident happened amid increased tension between Mareko and Meskan ethnic groups due to disputes over territory, currently administered under East Meskan woreda.

On 23 July 2023, followers of Orthodox Christians gathered to celebrate the 27th anniversary of Gimbi Kidane Meheret Church and protested the appointment of a new Patriarch to their Church by the Holy Synods in Gimbi town, Gimbi (West Wellega, Oromia). The Holy Synod announced the appointment of new Patriarch in Oromia and other regions, following the recent agreement to resolve a dispute between religious leaders in the region and the Federal Synod.

On 23 July 2023, a group of youths blocked road and threw stones against ENDF soldiers in Mekane Selam town, Borena-Debresina woreda (South Wello, Amhara) to demand the release of an alleged Fano member who was arrested by ENDF. ENDF fired live bullets on demonstrators and killed 2 and wounded 6. Unknown numbers of ENDF soldiers were also injured.

data.actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Amhara State Police
data.notes: On 22 July 2023, government forces (assumed to be Amhara Regional State Police and Kebele Communal Militias) exchanged fire with unidentified armed group (assumed to be Fano militias) in Woldiya town, Weldiya (North Wello, Amhara), after the armed group 'entered the town from different directions' during the night. 2 civilians were killed (including a humanitarian worker) in cross fire, and 2 Kebele militia men and a police officer were wounded. Local officials denied the 'exchange of gun fire' but accepted the claim that there were loud sounds of gun fire and casualties.

data.actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Oromia State Police
data.assoc_actor_1: Government of Ethiopia (2018-); PP: Prosperity Party
data.source: Addis Maleda; Addis Standard; BBC News; Oromiya Media Network
data.notes: On 22 July 2023, local government officials (Head of Woreda Peace and Security and Head of Woreda Prosperity Party) and security forces (coded as police forces Oromia state police), undressed and beat four peasants in front of a crowd of local people in Borcho Deka kebele (a location coded to admin center, Chira, in Gera woreda, Jimma, Oromia). The four farmers were accused of requesting the issuance of tax payment receipts. The zonal authorities condemned the attack and claimed to have 'arrested the local officials' after the video footages showing the scene was widely circulated on Social Media and caused uproar and distress among online communities.

Around 22 July 2023 (weekend of), unidentified gun men, allegedly Qemant ethnic militias, kidnapped and killed an unknown number of farmers in Das Gundo kebele (a location coded to admin center, Metema town), in Metema woreda (West Gondar, Amhara). An unidentified number of fatalities mentioned coded as 3. The armed group called families of the hostages and demanded ransom payment in exchange of their release.
